intro: Valeriana kilimandscharica subsp. aberdarica, commonly known as the Aberdaric valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its root system is known for containing volatile oils, which contribute to its use in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
